Title: Tinubu’s opposition lacks ideas, without record of performance – Presidency
Summary: Tinubu's opposition lacks ideas, without record of performance – Presidency . Presidency dismisses group as leftovers of a dying party seeking scapegoats and public attention .

Title: Controversy as Tinubu allegedly approves ADC Yusuf’s promotion
Summary: Trending reports suggest President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has approved the promotion of his Aide-de-Camp (ADC), Colonel Nurudeen Yusuf, to the rank of brigadier-general . Title: Haaland, Mbappe, Kane top Europe’s scoring chart after weekend matches
Summary: Erling Haaland, Kylian Mbappe and Harry Kane top Europe’s scoring chart after weekend matches . In the English Premier League, Manchester City beat Manchester United 2-0 in the Premier League .

Title: Soundz… A Bleu story of love and Afro-Pop
Summary: Soundz enters a new phase of Afro-Pop, merging emotion, experimentation, and his signature silky vocals . In this conversation, he reflects on growth, collaboration, and the moments that shaped his ascent . After Soundz, born Samuel Darasimi, broke out to perform .

Title: Sanwo-Olu advocates peace, unity as pillars of national stability
Summary: Lagos State Governor, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, urged Nigerians to embrace peace, unity, and forgiveness as pillars of national stability . He stressed that political cohesion and social harmony are critical to sustainable development . The governor made the call at the third anniversary of the Lagos state Senate .

Title: Emergency rule: President can suspend elected officials – Supreme Court
Summary: The Supreme Court affirmed the constitutional powers of the President to declare a state of emergency in any state of the federation to avert the breakdown of law and order .

Title: Russia outlaws feminist protest band Pussy Riot
Summary: Russia outlaws feminist protest band Pussy Riot . The label makes any interactions with the group illegal in Russia, even likes in social media, past or present .

Title: Man who ploughed car into Liverpool football parade to be sentenced
Summary: The sentencing hearing for the British man who ploughed his car through crowds of fans celebrating Liverpool's Premier League victory is set to begin on Monday . Over 100 people were injured in the attack, injuring over 100 people .

Title: African players in Europe: Salah off to AFCON amid uncertainty
Summary: Mohamed Salah heads for Morocco this week to captain Egypt in the Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) amid uncertainty over his future at Liverpool .

Title: Fubara’s Suspension: Supreme Court strikes out PDP Govs’ suit against Tinubu
Summary: The subject matter of the litigation did not qualify as a dispute between the federal government and any of the plaintiffs on record . According to the court, the subject matter . didn't qualify as an issue between the government and the plaintiffs .

Title: Residents praise C'River gov for free Christmas bus service
Summary: Residents of Calabar, capital of Cross River State, have praised Governor Bassey Otu’s free Christmas bus service . Title: US Consulate invites Nigerian students for pre-departure orientation
Summary: The US Consulate General in Lagos has announced a pre-departure orientation session for Nigerian students holding valid US student visas, aimed at preparing them for life and studies in the United States . Title: Things to know about INEC’s preliminary voters register display exercise
Summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission has commenced the display of the Preliminary Register of Voters at its Local Government Area offices across Nigeria . The exercise allows eligible voters to verify their registration details following the recently concluded Continuous Voter Registration exercise . Title: FUOYE matriculates over 11,000 students
Summary: The Vice Chancellor of the Federal University Oye Ekiti, Abayomi Fasina, urged fresh students to build a strong foundation for their lives through their actions and choices . Title: AFCON 2025: Uzoho declares readiness for Super Eagles return
Summary: Francis Uzoho has declared his readiness for international duty following his recall for the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations . The goalkeeper last featured for Nigeria in a March 2024 international friendly against Ghana, before missing subsequent competitive fixtures .
